"**You 've Got a Friend in Me**" is a song by [Randy
Newman](/wiki/Randy_Newman "Randy Newman"). Used as the [theme
song](/wiki/Theme_music "Theme music") for the 1995
[Disney](/wiki/Walt_Disney_Pictures "Walt Disney
Pictures")/[Pixar](/wiki/Pixar "Pixar") animated film _[Toy
Story](/wiki/Toy_Story "Toy Story")_ , it has since become a major musical
component for its sequels, _[Toy Story 2](/wiki/Toy_Story_2 "Toy Story 2")_
(1999) and _[Toy Story 3](/wiki/Toy_Story_3 "Toy Story 3")_ (2010) as well as
a musical [leitmotif](/wiki/Leitmotif "Leitmotif") throughout the whole [_Toy
Story_ franchise](/wiki/Toy_Story_\(franchise\) "Toy Story \(franchise\)").
The song was nominated for both the [Academy Award for Best Original
Song](/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Original_Song "Academy Award for Best
Original Song") and the [Golden Globe Award for Best Original
Song](/wiki/Golden_Globe_Award_for_Best_Original_Song "Golden Globe Award for
Best Original Song"), but lost both to "[Colors of the
Wind](/wiki/Colors_of_the_Wind "Colors of the Wind")" from Disney's
_[Pocahontas](/wiki/Pocahontas_\(1995_film\) "Pocahontas \(1995 film\)")_.

Like many other Disney theme songs, "You've Got a Friend in Me" has been
covered numerous times. Cover versions featured in the three _Toy Story_ films
include a duet with Newman and [Lyle Lovett](/wiki/Lyle_Lovett "Lyle Lovett")
in _[Toy Story](/wiki/Toy_Story "Toy Story");_ a
[diegetic](/wiki/Cinematic_techniques "Cinematic techniques") instance by [Tom
Hanks](/wiki/Tom_Hanks "Tom Hanks"), a version by [Robert
Goulet](/wiki/Robert_Goulet "Robert Goulet") and an instrumental by [Tom
Scott](/wiki/Tom_Scott_\(musician\) "Tom Scott \(musician\)") in _[Toy Story
2](/wiki/Toy_Story_2 "Toy Story 2")_ , and a [Spanish
language](/wiki/Spanish_language "Spanish language") version by the [Gipsy
Kings](/wiki/Gipsy_Kings "Gipsy Kings") in _[Toy Story 3](/wiki/Toy_Story_3
"Toy Story 3")_.

## In _Toy
Story_[[edit](/w/index.php?title=You%27ve_Got_a_Friend_in_Me&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: In Toy Story")]

The song is played during the opening credits for _Toy Story_ and _Toy Story
3_ , establishing the importance of Woody and Andy in the first film and the
importance of all his toys in the third. _Toy Story 3_ also uses it for irony
and dramatic effect, as the opening credits harken back to the first film and
the song abruptly fades out with "As the years go by/Our friendship will never
die", before showing that Andy's remaining toys in the present day are boxed
up and unused. When they were unused, Andy was 17 years old.

In the two sequels, the song is listened to by the characters as part of the
story. Two of these are cover versions done at the end of the film for
thematic reasons: at the end of _Toy Story 2_ , the character Wheezy starts to
sing it to the other toys; during the end credits of _Toy Story 3_ , Buzz
Lightyear and Jessie (now a couple) perform a [pasodoble](/wiki/Pasodoble
"Pasodoble") to a Spanish version of the song, deliberately played by Jessie
to get Buzz to dance.

The most significant use of the song was in the third act of _Toy Story 2_ ,
where an episode of _Woody 's Roundup_ (the 1950s puppet show he was based on)
shows the puppet Woody singing the song, directed at the young audience and
featuring a small child hugging the puppet. Woody sees this and has an
[epiphany](/wiki/Epiphany_\(feeling\) "Epiphany \(feeling\)"), realizing that
his mission as a toy is to be there for a child. (In-universe, the song was
presumably written for _Woody 's Roundup_.)

The _Woody 's Roundup_ version was performed by [Tom Hanks](/wiki/Tom_Hanks
"Tom Hanks"), with acoustic guitar backing; Wheezy's version was sung by
[Robert Goulet](/wiki/Robert_Goulet "Robert Goulet") (though the character was
voiced by [Joe Ranft](/wiki/Joe_Ranft "Joe Ranft")); and the Spanish version,
"You've Got a Friend in Me (Para el Buzz Español)", was performed by the
[Gipsy Kings](/wiki/Gipsy_Kings "Gipsy Kings").

## Cover
versions[[edit](/w/index.php?title=You%27ve_Got_a_Friend_in_Me&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Cover versions")]

[Michael Bublé](/wiki/Michael_Bubl%C3%A9 "Michael Bublé") covered "You've Got
a Friend in Me" on his 2013 album, _[To Be Loved](/wiki/To_Be_Loved "To Be
Loved")_. The track became a U.S. Adult Contemporary chart hit, spending 14
weeks on the chart and peaking at number 10.[2]

On May 31st, 2018, [Rex Orange County](/wiki/Rex_Orange_County "Rex Orange
County") released a cover of “You’ve Got a Friend in Me”, performing along
with [Randy Newman](/wiki/Randy_Newman "Randy Newman"), the creator of the
song.
